CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 25, 1952, pg. 17, reads: "Thousands in Square And Along The Route - When President Harry S. Truman visited the Hill District Wednesday night and made his 'whistle-stop' address in the square adjacent to Centre Avenue Police Station, thousands of persons waited to listen to him. Several thousand others lined the streets to catch a glimpse of him along his route to Syria Mosque where he made a nation-wide television and radio broadcast.  One of the curious things that occurred happened when two of the spectators unfurled the banner, "We Like Ike" shown above.  The crowd at Centre Avenue Police Station was estimated by police at 10,000 persons. - Harris Photo"
TitMainTitle: Crowd on sidewalk and street in front of Sparkle Super Market and New Granada Theater, during President Truman visit, Centre Avenue and Dinwiddie Street, Hill District, at night
